DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to analysis the volatile organic gases(VOCs) in exhaled breath of pulmonary lesion patients and healthy controls, in order to find the difference of composition and concentration among groups.
DOC.brief_title: The Value of VOCs Analysis in Exhaled Breath for Pulmonary Benign and Malignant Lesion Diagnosis
DOC.detailed_description: Collect the exhaled gas in pulmonary lesion patients and healthy controls, using proton transfer reaction mass spectrometry to analysis the different composition and concentration of VOCs, to find the biomarker gases of distinguishing benign and malignant lesion of lung among different groups， and try to build a diagnostic model for lung lesion.
DOC.criteria: cohort 1 : Inclusion criteria: Patients newly diagnosed with primary lung cancer by tissue biopsy and did not receive any treatment aiming at the tumor, including chemotherapy and radiotherapy. Age ≥ 18 years cohort 2： Inclusion criteria： Patients diagnosed with pulmonary benign lesion by tissue biopsy or other examination. Age ≥ 18 years patients who have more than one type of carcinoma patients diagnosed type 2 diabetes mellitus patients diagnosed chronic renal failure patients diagnosed upper digestive tract ulcer patients who reject to sign the informed consent from cohort 3： Healthy controls Volunteers without diagnosed lung diseases and pulmonary symptoms.
